smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function folderSize appears to be too complex.
The function doBackgroundWork appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function folderSize is nested too deeply.
Function doBackgroundWork is nested too deeply.
Function onCreateDialog is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

instances.message: The file name 'Extensions.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'FileUtils'.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message: activity cannot be safely cast to StartActivity.
findPreference(getString(R.string.pref_key_log_file)) cannot be safely cast to SwitchPreferenceCompat?.
findPreference(getString(R.string.pref_key_crashlytics_always_send)) cannot be safely cast to SwitchPreferenceCompat.
newValue cannot be safely cast to Boolean.
activity cannot be safely cast to Context.

smells.description: Checks whether files end with a line separator.

smells.name: UtilityClassWithPublicConstructor
smells.description: The class declaration is unnecessary because it only contains utility functions. An object declaration should be used instead.

instances.message: The class ErrorReporter only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.
The class FileUtils only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.name: ExpressionBodySyntax
smells.description: Functions with exact one statement, the return statement, can be rewritten with ExpressionBodySyntax.

smells.name: MandatoryBracesIfStatements
smells.description: Multi-line if statement was found that does not have braces. These should be added to improve readability.

instances.message: Multi-line if statement was found that does not have braces. These should be added to improve readability.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the package declaration and the list of imports.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FileUtils.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of DataFolderMigrationWorker.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of DataFolderDialog.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: androidx.work.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
